metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9211 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
The crypto_skcipher_init_tfm function in crypto/skcipher.c in the Linuxkernel through 4.11.2 relies on a setkey function that lacks a key-sizecheck, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointerdereference) via a crafted application.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9211` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1059-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').

linux-lts-wily: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1').
